alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:53PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Raleigh and southern Fayette Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 653 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Babcock State Park to near Oak Hill to near Mount Hope. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Bradley, Prosperity, Piney View, Stanaford, Shady Spring, Daniels, Beaver, Meadow Bridge, Pax and Thurmond. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 47 and 49, and between mile markers 51 and 54. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 124 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern West Virginia.
